title: Late Night Aircraft Departures
description: A. SUMMARY This dataset consists of late-night flights departing between 1:00 a.m. and 5:00 a.m. It serves to quantify, measure, and report on how well airlines use over-water routing established by the Federal Aviation Administration and reduce aircraft overflying the San Francisco Peninsula to help mitigate noise. This information is the data source used to produce a one-page report, “NIITE to GOBBS 1 a.m. to 5 a.m.” on page 5 of the monthly Airport Director’s Report. This report is available online at https://www.flysfo.com/about/community-noise/noise-office/reports/airport-directors-report B. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET It is important to note that not all flight records will have measurement details associated with the two navigation waypoints used in this analysis because not all flights will use them. However, there will be flights that flew by both navigation waypoints, so those respective measurement details are provided. C. UPDATE PROCESS Data is available starting in September 2022 and will be updated on a monthly basis. Please contact the Noise Abatement Office at NoiseAbatementOffice@flysfo.com for any questions regarding this data. Date created: May 30, 2023

columns.name: operation_no
columns.description: Unique number to identify individual flight track record.

columns.name: airport_id
columns.description: International Air Transport Association (IATA) 3-letter location identifier for the airport the flight originated from.

columns.name: corr_id
columns.description: Number that links analysis details to an Operation.

columns.name: actual_date_time
columns.description: The Date/Time the flight operation departed San Francisco International Airport or Oakland International Airport.

columns.name: other_port
columns.description: International Air Transport Association (IATA) 3-letter location identifier for the airport the flight is bound for.

columns.name: flight_no
columns.description: Flight ID associated with a flight operation.

columns.name: tail_no
columns.description: Is an alphanumeric code used to identify a specific airplane.

columns.name: airline
columns.description: The aircraft operating company's 3-letter International Civil Aviation Organization designator.

columns.name: aircraft_type
columns.description: Type of aircraft used for the flight operation.

columns.name: runway_name
columns.description: The name of the runway the aircraft operated on.

columns.name: operator_category
columns.description: Operators categorized by letter into the following categories: A=Airline, C=Cargo, F=Fractional, G=General Aviation, L=Lifeflight, M=Military, O=Other, T=Air Taxi, U=Unknown.

columns.name: ac_category
columns.description: Aircraft categorized by letter into the following categories: B=Business Jet, H=Helicopter, J=Commercial Jet, R=Regional Jet, T=Turboprop Aircraft

columns.name: operation_type
columns.description: Identifies the flight operation: A=Arrival, D=Departure, O=Overflight, G=Ground, T=Touch&Go.

columns.name: route_name
columns.description: Assigned route name based on which analysis gate the flight track penetrates.

columns.name: gate_penetration_time
columns.description: Date/Time the flight track penetrates a 3-dimensional analysis gate.

columns.name: niite_pca_timestamp
columns.description: Date/Time of the flight track's point-of-closest approach to the center of an inverted trapezium (a selection tool) at NIITE waypoint (37.845242, -122.386869)

columns.name: niite_slant_dist (m)
columns.description: Slant Distance is calculated between the flight track’s point-of-closest approach to the center of an inverted trapezium (a selection tool) and to the center of the trapezium at sea level, in meters.

columns.name: niite_hag_alt (m)
columns.description: The altitude of the aircraft is calculated between the flight track’s point-of-closest approach to the center of an inverted trapezium (a selection tool) and sea level, in meters.

columns.name: gobbs_pca_timestamp
columns.description: Date/Time of the flight track's point-of-closest approach to the center of an inverted trapezium (a selection tool) at GOBBS waypoint (37.77131667, -122.6581194)

columns.name: gobbs_slant_dist (m)
columns.description: Slant Distance is calculated between the flight track’s point-of-closest approach to the center of an inverted trapezium (a selection tool) and to the center of the trapezium at sea level, in meters.

columns.name: gobbs_hag_alt (m)
columns.description: The altitude of the aircraft is calculated between the flight track’s point-of-closest approach to the center of an inverted trapezium (a selection tool) and sea level, in meters.

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Date and time source data was updated.

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Date the data was loaded onto the Open Data Portal

whom_it_may_interest: Airport operations staff, noise abatement groups, transportation policy makers, environmental researchers

queries.Monthly: SELECT airline, airport_id, operator_category, ac_category, route_name, date_trunc_ym(actual_date_time) AS month, COUNT(*) AS flights_count WHERE actual_date_time >= '2022-09-01' GROUP BY airline, airport_id, operator_category, ac_category, route_name, month ORDER BY month, airline, airport_id, operator_category, ac_category, route_name
queries.Yearly: SELECT airline, airport_id, operator_category, ac_category, route_name, date_trunc_y(actual_date_time) AS year, COUNT(*) AS flights_count WHERE actual_date_time >= '2022-09-01' GROUP BY airline, airport_id, operator_category, ac_category, route_name, year ORDER BY year, airline, airport_id, operator_category, ac_category, route_name
